titleStmt.title: Cordifragium, or, The sacrifice of a broken heart, open'd, offer'd, own'd, and honour'd. Presented in a sermon at St Pauls London, November 25. 1660. By Francis Walsall D.D. chaplain to his Majesty, and prebendary of St. Peters Westminster.
titleStmt.author: Walsall, Francis, d. 1661.

titleStmt.title: Cordifragium, or, The sacrifice of a broken heart, open'd, offer'd, own'd, and honour'd. Presented in a sermon at St Pauls London, November 25. 1660. By Francis Walsall D.D. chaplain to his Majesty, and prebendary of St. Peters Westminster.
titleStmt.author: Walsall, Francis, d. 1661.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Abraham Miller, for John Sherley, at the Golden Pelican in little Brittain,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: The sacrifice of a broken heart opened, offered, owned, and honoured.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "feb: 6", "1660 Feb. 6"; 1 in imprint date crossed out and "0" written in.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
